title: How to stop sharing my screen with hackers - Quora

response.answer_text: If you have some malware on your computer that allows a hacker to access your screen, you have to figure out what it is and remove it. If necessary, try booting a USB Linux to run a malware scan directly without booting your windows system. Make sure that there really is a hacker on your system, this is a common scam to claim that you are being monitored and they just want to make you pay some money.

This is the most dangerous experience if our computer is hacked by someone else. I order to prevent from such attacks we had best update our computer and install the required antivirus software for preventing it from virus, malwares ets. Another major problem is the social engineer ing attacks. A malicious attacker attach an expolit with an email and after clicking on the email link, your system might be compromise d. So beware……..

What makes you think the “hackers” are telling you the truth—about anything. Perhaps they have just found one of your passwords from the million that have been stolen over the years and are just milking it. Perhaps they are telling you lies just to get some money out you, and they actually know very little about you.
